title: Bug 38131: ajc needs -d option while correctly compiling classes from subpackage
OB: A directory called 'subpackage' is created under the existing 'subpackage' directory when compiling a class using the 'ajc' command.
EB: The compiled class should be placed in the existing 'subpackage' directory when using the 'ajc' command.
SR: To reproduce the issue, compile a class from a subpackage using the 'ajc' command with the -d option.
